children.description: The AsyncAPI specification version of this document.
children.name: asyncapi

children.description: A unique id representing the application.
children.name: id
info

children.description: A unique and precise title of the API.
children.name: title

children.description: A semantic version number of the API.
children.name: version

children.description: A longer description of the API. Should be different from the title. CommonMark is allowed.
children.name: description

children.description: A URL to the Terms of Service for the API. MUST be in the format of a URL.
children.name: termsOfService
contact

children.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.
children.name: name

children.description: The URL pointing to the contact information.
children.name: url

children.description: The email address of the contact person/organization.
children.name: email
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
Contact information for the exposed API.

children.name: license

children.description: The name of the license type. It's encouraged to use an OSI compatible license.
children.name: name

children.description: The URL pointing to the license.
children.name: url
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
License information for the exposed API.

children.name: ^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
The object provides metadata about the API. The metadata can be used by the clients if needed.

children.name: servers
$ref
children.description: A simple object to allow referencing other components in the specification, internally and externally.

children.name: server

children.description: A URL to the target host. This URL supports Server Variables and MAY be relative, to indicate that the host location is relative to the location where the AsyncAPI document is being served.
children.name: url

children.description: An optional string describing the host designated by the URL. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.
children.name: description

children.description: The protocol this URL supports for connection. Supported protocol include, but are not limited to: amqp, amqps, http, https, ibmmq, jms, kafka, kafka-secure, anypointmq, mqtt, secure-mqtt, solace, stomp, stomps, ws, wss, mercure, googlepubsub.
children.name: protocol

children.description: The version of the protocol used for connection. For instance: AMQP 0.9.1, HTTP 2.0, Kafka 1.0.0, etc.
children.name: protocolVersion

children.description: A map between a variable name and its value. The value is used for substitution in the server's URL template.
children.name: variables
$ref
children.description: A simple object to allow referencing other components in the specification, internally and externally.

children.name: serverVariable

children.description: An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are from a limited set.
children.name: enum

children.description: The default value to use for substitution, and to send, if an alternate value is not supplied.
children.name: default

children.description: An optional description for the server variable.
children.name: description

children.description: An array of examples of the server variable.
children.name: examples
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
An object representing a Server Variable for server URL template substitution.
Lists of the required security schemes that can be used to execute an operation
children.name: security

children.description: Map describing protocol-specific definitions for a server.
children.name: bindings

children.description: Allows adding meta data to a single tag.
children.name: tags

children.description: The name of the tag.
children.name: name

children.description: A short description for the tag.
children.name: description

children.description: Allows referencing an external resource for extended documentation.
children.name: externalDocs

children.description: A short description of the target documentation.
children.name: description

children.description: The URL for the target documentation. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URL.
children.name: url
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.

children.name: ^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.

children.name: ^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
An object representing a message broker, a server or any other kind of computer program capable of sending and/or receiving data
The Servers Object is a map of Server Objects.

tags.name: env:development
tags.description: This environment is meant for developers to run their own tests

tags.name: env:staging
tags.description: This environment is a replica of the production environment

tags.name: env:production
tags.description: This environment is the live environment available for final users

children.name: parameters

children.name: parameter

children.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use. GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.
children.name: description
schema
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.

children.name: allOf
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
Adds support for polymorphism. The discriminator is the schema property name that is used to differentiate between other schema that inherit this schema.
children.name: discriminator

children.description: Allows referencing an external resource for extended documentation.
children.name: externalDocs

children.description: A short description of the target documentation.
children.name: description

children.description: The URL for the target documentation. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URL.
children.name: url
^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$
children.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.
Specifies that a schema is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of usage
children.name: deprecated

children.description: The Schema Object allows the definition of input and output data types. These types can be objects, but also primitives and arrays.

^x-[\w\d\.\x2d_]+$

children.description: The names of the servers on which this channel is available. If absent or empty then this channel must be available on all servers.
